step1.para: Place the larger low range synchronizer on a bench with pins up. Place the sliding clutch on LO range synchronizer pins, recessed side up ( Figure 160).

figure.caption: Figure 160. Place Sliding Clutch on LO Range Synchronizer Pins

note.para: Pins on LO range synchronizer must line up with chamfered holes on the bottom of the sliding clutch.

step1.para: Install the three springs in the bores of the high range synchronizer ring ( Figure 161).

figure.caption: Figure 161. Install Springs in Bores of High Range Synchronizer Ring

step1.para: Place the high range synchronizer ring over the pins of the low speed synchronizer ring, seating the springs against the pins ( Figure 162).

figure.caption: Figure 162. Place High Range Synchronizer Ring Over Pins of Low Speed Synchronizer Ring

step1.para: Apply downward pressure to the high range synchronizer ring WHILE TWISTING COUNTERCLOCKWISE to compress the springs and fully seat the ring on the blocker pins of the low range synchronizer ( Figure 163). It is suggested that a shop towel be placed over the synchronizer to prevent injury to your hands.

figure.caption: Figure 163. Apply Downward Pressure to High Range Synchronizer Ring

step1.para: Install the synchronizer assembly to the front of the output shaft assembly ( Figure 164).
